page.title: 12THE WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE
page.content: The farmer's wife we interviewed is involved in{VOLUNTARY SERVICES}and the {WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE.} The WRI meets once a month mainly for entertainment but cookery and embroidery classes are also run. However, fewer people attend now because of TV. In the 1940's there were 144 members - today only 70. Altogether there are 53 WRI's in Angus. The Institute holds an annual 'show' in March and they also have a stand at the Royal Highland Show. Her voluntary service is{MEALS ON {WHEELS.}She does this twice a week once a month. The meals are collected from a local hospital and distributed to elderly people in Inveraldie and Tealing.
